subject: RE: [junit] RE: [OT] NoClassdefFoundError (was: Exception handling by junit)
msgSnippet: ... I m currently working on a problem where a class cannot be loaded because it contains a catch block catching a JNLP exception, but the jnlp.jar is not in
messageBody:
> In my experience, a missing class file results in a
> ClassNotFoundException. ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when
> you _can_ find the class, but not a resulting definition.

I'm currently working on a problem where a class cannot be loaded because it
contains a catch block catching a JNLP exception, but the jnlp.jar is not in
the classpath. This results in a ClassDefNotFoundError, not an Exception.
(And no, no static initializer involved.)

Cheers, Ilja
